snippet: Activists say the story of Somaly Mam is part of a larger tale of deception meant to attract foreign money into impoverished Cambodia.
abstract: Somaly Mam, one of Cambodia's most prominent social activists, had stepped down from United States-based charitable organization bearing her name after questions arose about her claim that she was orphan sold into sex slavery; her fall from grace highlights what aid workers in country say is widespread embellishment and in some cases outright deception in fund-raising, especially among the country's orphanages.

byline.contributor: Julia Wallace and Poypiti Amatatham contributed reporting from Phnom Penh.

lead_paragraph: Activists say the story of Somaly Mam is part of a larger tale of deception meant to attract foreign money into impoverished Cambodia.

headline.main: Cambodian Activist’s Fall Exposes Broad Deception
headline.print_headline: Cambodian Activist’s Fall Exposes Broad Deception
